page.title: 17My Family's Life Styles
page.content: My family came from Wembley about 12 years ago,so that my dad could go round mending cookers and washing machines and micro-waves etc.He has a van and it says T.I. Creda (T.I.means "Trust It.") My mum and my sister work in rest homes for the elderly.Old people pay to live in such buildings where they are looked after by the owner and his staff or by a warden. I am mad on football. I play for Hastings Town Football Club and Spartans Football Club.I also go to Hollington Youth Centre,and do break dancing.I can do handspins, headspins, donkey kicks,windmills, caterpillars, turtles,backspins, knee spins,crazy legs, swipes and halos. These are all names given to ways of moving acrobatically to modern beat music.
